{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fluoride flux is used in the soldering process to clean the metal surfaces and prevent the formation of oxides that could interfere with the soldering process. It does not increase the strength of solder or prevent the flow of material in undesirable areas. The question is whether it prevents the formation of copper oxide or chromium oxide. Fluoride flux is more commonly associated with preventing the formation of copper oxide.", "answer_choice": "A"}
